about.description:
Lux Fundació is a charity initiative conceived by a committed group of music enthusiasts. It has two main goals:

1. Support entities dedicated to charitable work.

2. Bringing early music played in a historically authentic way to a wider audience. To achieve these goals, the foundation has its own permanent set of baroque instruments: Lux ensemble and Lux ​​consort of viols.

Wide experience and many years of study guarantee the quality of the group. A characteristic of the ensemble is its flexibility in terms of the number of performers for each project or concert. Our intention is to be able to offer a very wide repertoire that includes orchestral and chamber concerts or recitals by individual musicians. Our guiding principle is to create meticulously prepared events that are historically and musicologically authentic, using the instruments for which the pieces were originally created. In this way, we aim to transport listeners to the magnificent Europe of the 17th and 18th centuries, while making a contribution to charity.

All profits from Lux Fundació events go to dedicated organizations to specific initiatives for those most in need. The objective is to act as a tool for any non-profit entity to finance its work, whether it is the construction of a school, the provision of a medical service or any other worthwhile initiative.

Lux Fundació has its own label: LUX RECORDS. In 2014 came the 1st album: "Suonate en trio per diversi strumenti di JS Bach", and in 2015 came the 2nd: "Prayers and Dances. Of battles, xácaras, parades and other tientos".
